intro: Hampea ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hampea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Colombia. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
